thank you so much! I just followed the instructions and it worked great! It took like 1 min to download and 1 min to install so it's extremely fast! And it's very simple.

(if your OS is vista or 7 and you get any error or it doesn't work try running the thing that gave you a error or repeat the hole procedure as administrator before you ask for help)

1: Run the installer (Alcohol120_retail_2.0.0.1331.exe) and install the program

2: Copy the patch (PatCh5121ML.exe) to your alcohol 120% installation folder and run it

3: I'm not sure if this is necessary but I copied the file "AutoLoader_AxLaUn.exe" to the alcohol 120% installation folder and then ran it

4: When you first start the application you may notice that it says that it's not registered but it will only say that the first time you use it, next time it will say that it's registered.

5: Done

Thanks for the UL!

That has got to be one of the dumbest most stupid comments I've seen. Oh poor frustrated user believing the Alcohol website blocked him for pirating their product, without a single clue that something like this NEVER happens.

The sweet sweet irony is that the crack adds the alcohol website addreses in the windows hosts file, thereby blocking the entire machine from accessing it. This is done in order to prevent serial and update checking and allow the cracked install to stay untouched.

And here he is, the poor soul, frustrated by an inexistent punishment which is actually a protection put up by the crack itself.
Moron. The block is the crack itself having added the website to the hosts file to prevent alcohol from validating the serial online.

This download contains multiple files infected with viruses, however the Alcohol 120% installer and the Crack file both came up clean. So the important stuff is clean and every other file included should be avoided at all costs.

https://www.virustotal.com/file/780788d17ea8ff33abac434f7624f97d33ff215d43d53f59b27739e5e01ca0d9/analysis/1330580852/

13/43 say it is a keygen (Obvious result), 5/43 heuristic (guess) results, 5/43 suggest an infection of some sort.

So 18/43 don't say it is definitely infected with a virus, 20/43 say it isn't infected at all, 5 report it is definitely infected with a virus.
